name: Sounding Rocket Curriculum - 3
description: A stuctured curriculum in Rocketry covering the core of rocketry, electronics, and mechanical design.
goal: To prepare a team to successfully design, build, and launch a competitive sounding rocket for the Spaceport America Cup competition with team members.

courses.name: Rocketry Basics for Spaceport America Cup
courses.description: This course provides foundational knowledge in rocketry principles for teams preparing to compete in the Spaceport America Cup. The curriculum is designed for individuals with limited rocketry experience but with strong programming skills, focusing on essential concepts that will serve as building blocks for more advanced topics.
courses.goal: To understand fundamental rocketry concepts and principles necessary for designing a successful sounding rocket.

courses.name: Electronics and Sensors for Sounding Rockets
courses.description: This course covers the essential electronics and sensor systems required for a successful sounding rocket in the Spaceport America Cup competition. Building on the team's strong programming background, this curriculum focuses on practical implementation of electronic systems that interface with the physical rocket components.
courses.goal: To design and implement reliable electronic systems for flight control, data acquisition, and recovery deployment.

courses.name: Mechanical Design and Construction Process
courses.description: This course covers the mechanical design and construction processes required for building a successful sounding rocket for the Spaceport America Cup competition. It addresses the needs of a team with limited mechanical experience but strong programming skills, focusing on practical approaches that can be implemented within a 3-month timeframe.
courses.goal: To design and construct a reliable rocket airframe and recovery system that meets competition requirements.

courses.name: Programming and Data Acquisition for Sounding Rockets
courses.description: This course leverages the team's strong programming expertise to develop robust software systems for data acquisition, flight control, and analysis for a Spaceport America Cup sounding rocket. The curriculum focuses on practical implementation of programming solutions that interface with the electronic and mechanical systems previously covered.
courses.goal: To develop software systems for data acquisition, control, and analysis that integrate with the rocket's physical systems.

courses.name: Project Timeline and Team Roles
courses.description: This course outlines a comprehensive project timeline and team role structure for a 4-person team building a sounding rocket for the Spaceport America Cup competition within a 3-month timeframe. The plan leverages the team's strong programming expertise while addressing the limited experience in rocketry, electronics, and mechanical design.
courses.goal: To establish an effective project management framework and timeline for completing the rocket within the 3-month constraint.

items.name: Newton's First Law: Inertia (edited item)
items.description: A rocket at rest will remain at rest, and a rocket in motion will remain in motion at constant velocity unless acted upon by an external force.
items.goal: To understand how inertia affects rocket launch and flight phases.

items.name: Newton's Second Law: F = ma
items.description: The relationship between thrust, mass, and acceleration in rocket flight.
items.goal: To understand how changing mass affects rocket acceleration during flight.

items.name: Newton's Third Law: Action and Reaction
items.description: The fundamental principle behind rocket propulsion.
items.goal: To understand how expelled propellant creates forward thrust.

items.name: Tsiolkovsky's Rocket Equation
items.description: The fundamental equation relating change in velocity to exhaust velocity and mass ratio: V = V  ln(m/m).
items.goal: To apply the rocket equation to performance calculations.

items.name: Specific Impulse (Isp)
items.description: A measure of how efficiently a rocket uses propellant.
items.goal: To understand specific impulse and its importance in rocket performance.

items.name: Mass Relationships
items.description: The relationship between propellant mass, structural mass, and payload mass.
items.goal: To understand mass distribution in rocket design.

items.name: Mass Ratio Optimization

items.goal: To apply mass ratio optimization to rocket design.
